alert.note: Alert for Buncombe; Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 6:41PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Henderson and eastern Buncombe Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Downtown Asheville, or near Bent Creek, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Downtown Asheville, East Asheville, Arden, West Asheville, North Asheville, Black Mountain, Fletcher, Swannanoa, Fairview In Buncombe County and Biltmore Forest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
